titleproper.value:
Guide to the Max Zaritsky Papers
                    <num>TAM.006</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T16:40-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Max Zaritsky (1885-1959) was an officer, and sometime president, of two hat industry unions, the Cloth Hat, Cap, and Millinery Workers' International Union, and its successor, the United Hatters, Cap, and Millinery Workers International Union. The papers include correspondence with labor and industry leaders, clippings, manuscripts, minutes, typescripts of radio addresses and speeches, and memorabilia and printed material covering hat industry union affairs, political and Zionist activities of the labor movement, and the conflict between the American Federation of Labor and the newly formed Congress of Industrial Organizations.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Max Zaritsky at Fifty. The Story of an Aggressive Labor Leadership (1935).</item>
                    <item>Biographical Dictionary of American Labor (1984).</item>
                    <item>Labor Unions (1977). Includes historical sketches of the various hat industry unions, pp. 139-144.</item>
                </list>

The papers include correspondence with labor and industry leaders, clippings, manuscripts, minutes, typescripts of radio addresses and speeches, memorabilia and printed material covering hat industry union affairs, political and Zionist activities of the labor movement, and the conflict between the American Federation of Labor and the newly formed Congress of Industrial Organizations.

subject.value: Hat trade |x Labor unions |z United States.
Industrial technicians |x Labor unions |z United States.

corpname.value: United Hatters, Cap, and Millinery Workers International Union.
